body_html:
It's nice to have a TensorFlow wheel provided by Intel for their Xeon Phi cards. I should have tried it on a different machine. Unfortunately, after the wheel installation, my old nemesis is back with a warning that the binary was not compiled to use: SSE4.1, SSE4.2, AVX, AVX2, FMA.

Source:
https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/intel-optimized-tensorflow-wheel-now-available#

Python 2.7

pip install https://anaconda.org/intel/tensorflow/1.4.0/download/tensorflow-1.4.0-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl

Python 3.5

pip install https://anaconda.org/intel/tensorflow/1.3.0/download/tensorflow-1.3.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl

Python 3.6

pip install https://anaconda.org/intel/tensorflow/1.4.0/download/tensorflow-1.4.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl

Warning:
Python 2.7.5 (default, May 3 2017, 07:55:04)
[GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-14)] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

import tensorflow as tf
sess = tf.Session()
2018-01-03 12:53:16.067051: I tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:137] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: SSE4.1 SSE4.2 AVX AVX2 FMA

There is also a claim by someone stating that CPU with MKL is slower than just CPU support:
mind/wheels#12

Are my times optimal or is there something I can do to increase performance?

Sample:
sudo git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/models.git
python models/tutorials/image/mnist/convolutional.py --batch_size=32

Step 0 (epoch 0.00), 3.2 ms
Minibatch loss: 8.334, learning rate: 0.010000
Minibatch error: 85.9%
Validation error: 84.6%
Step 100 (epoch 0.12), 26.2 ms
Minibatch loss: 3.250, learning rate: 0.010000
Minibatch error: 6.2%
Validation error: 7.7%
Step 200 (epoch 0.23), 24.6 ms
Minibatch loss: 3.359, learning rate: 0.010000
Minibatch error: 10.9%
Validation error: 4.2%
Step 300 (epoch 0.35), 24.4 ms
Minibatch loss: 3.139, learning rate: 0.010000
Minibatch error: 3.1%
Validation error: 3.0%
Step 400 (epoch 0.47), 23.8 ms
Minibatch loss: 3.197, learning rate: 0.010000
Minibatch error: 4.7%
Validation error: 2.6%
Step 500 (epoch 0.58), 24.0 ms
Minibatch loss: 3.166, learning rate: 0.010000
Minibatch error: 6.2%
Validation error: 2.3%

body:
It's nice to have a TensorFlow wheel provided by Intel for their Xeon Phi cards. I should have tried it on a different machine. Unfortunately, after the wheel installation, my old nemesis is back with a warning that the binary was not compiled to use: SSE4.1, SSE4.2, AVX, AVX2, FMA. Source: https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/intel-optimized-tensorflow-wheel-now-available# # Python 2.7 pip install https://anaconda.org/intel/tensorflow/1.4.0/download/tensorflow-1.4.0-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl # Python 3.5 pip install https://anaconda.org/intel/tensorflow/1.3.0/download/tensorflow-1.3.0-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl # Python 3.6 pip install https://anaconda.org/intel/tensorflow/1.4.0/download/tensorflow-1.4.0-cp36-cp36m-linux_x86_64.whl Warning: Python 2.7.5 (default, May 3 2017, 07:55:04) [GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-14)] on linux2 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import tensorflow as tf >>> sess = tf.Session() 2018-01-03 12:53:16.067051: I tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:137] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: SSE4.1 SSE4.2 AVX AVX2 FMA There is also a claim by someone stating that CPU with MKL is slower than just CPU support: https://github.com/mind/wheels/issues/12 Are my times optimal or is there something I can do to increase performance? Sample: sudo git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/models.git python models/tutorials/image/mnist/convolutional.py --batch_size=32 Step 0 (epoch 0.00), 3.2 ms
Minibatch loss: 8.334, learning rate: 0.010000
